item.title: Trump's social media following skyrockets by millions post-assassination attempt
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 4 suspects, including 2 Mexicans, arrested in South Africa's biggest drug bust
item.description: South African police apprehend four suspects, including two Mexican nationals, in a large-scale meth lab bust in Groblersdal. The lab contained chemicals worth $109.5 million. Uncertainty remains regarding the intended distribution of the drugs. Suspects to appear in court on Monday.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'I took back the power': Miss Kansas confronts abuser present in pageant audience
item.description: Miss Kansas, Alexis Smith, dedicates her platform to ending abusive relationships. Confronting her abuser onstage and sharing her story on Facebook, she’s representing Butler County in Miss America 2024. The ICU nurse, who has faced domestic violence since age 14, earned praise from the Rhode Island Coalition Against Domestic Violence and widespread social media support for her advocacy.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'We are going to win': VP Kamala Harris assures worried Democratic donors
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: How a typical campaign ad opened discussion on outdated Canadian liquor control system
item.description: Ontario Premier Doug Ford posted an ad amid the LCBO strike by 9,000 employees. He launched a map of regional breweries and promised faster canned cocktails in private retailers. Despite a tentative deal, the strike continues. Union spokesperson Katie Arnup revealed at a news conference that bargaining basics and the return-to-work order caused controversy.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Israel kills dozens as it steps up Gaza bombardment
Three 'pro-Russian' hackers arrested in Spain over cyberattacks
Global allies to bolster Ukraine if US backs away under Trump, says Blinken
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Jerome Boateng given suspended fine, warning in assault case
item.description: Ex-Bayern Munich player Boateng received a suspended fine of €200,000 ($227,000), which he would only have to pay if he committed another offense.

item.title: US woman released from jail after 43 years for a murder she did not commit
item.description: Hemme was serving a life sentence at the Chillicothe Correctional Center for the 1980 stabbing death of library worker Patricia Jeschke in St Joseph, Missouri.​​
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Who is 'Hello Kitty' a fictional cat character or a little girl?
item.description: After 50 years of misconception, it has been clarified that Hello Kitty is not a cat but actually a little girl named Kitty White. Created by Sanrio in 1947, the character's backstory includes growing up in London with her family and pet cat. Fans are adjusting to this new revelation.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'If Biden doesn't have cognitive function ...': JD Vance targets Biden's presidential bid
item.description: Ohio Senator JD Vance criticised President Biden's cognitive abilities on social media, questioning his fitness to remain in office. This followed Biden's underwhelming debate performance with Trump and increasing calls from Democrats for him to step aside. Despite party pressure and testing positive for Covid-19, Biden reaffirmed his commitment to continue his campaign, countering Trump's agenda and advocating for his vision of America's future.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Israeli settlements on occupied land are illegal, ICJ rules
item.description: The International Court of Justice declares Israel's settlement policies in Palestinian territories a violation of international law. Israeli Prime Minister Netanyahu criticizes the ruling. The conflict persists with Israel's rejection of Palestinian statehood. The ICJ is also reviewing a genocide accusation by South Africa.

item.title: Global tech outage spotlights fragility of growing cyber era
A family affair for 'Grandpa' Trump
CrowdStrike shuts down world's Windows for hours
item.description: CrowdStrike's Falcon Sensor update caused a massive IT outage impacting global sectors. Airlines like IndiGo, Akasa Air, Air India Express, and SpiceJet faced delays. Retailers, including Tata Starbucks, experienced PoS issues. Financial markets were disrupted. CrowdStrike CEO George Kurtz apologized. Ciaran Martin emphasized fragility. PwC called it a Black Swan event. PhonePe's Share.market faced issues.

item.title: 40 dead, several injured after migrant boat catches fire off Haiti coast
item.description: A tragic incident off Haiti's northern coast claims the lives of 40 migrants as their boat catches fire. The escalating violence and poverty in Haiti drive increasing migration, with over 86,000 migrants forcibly returned this year alone. International efforts aim to stabilize the country amidst the crisis. "Haiti's socioeconomic situation is in agony," remarked Gregoire Goodstein, IOM's chief of mission in Haiti. "The extreme violence over the past months has only brought Haitians to resort to desperate measures even more."
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
